newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Feb house material prices rise 0.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Australian Feb house material prices rise 0.2 pct.

text.p: Australian house building materials prices rose 0.2 percent in February and were 0.6 percent higher than a year earlier, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
Other building materials rose 0.4 percent in February and were 0.6 percent higher than a year before, the bureau also said.
An increase in prices for metal roofing and guttering, structural timber and readymixed concrete were the main contributors to the rise in the house building materials, it said.
An increase in prices for steel decking and cladding was the main contributor to the rise in the non-housing materials, followed by increases for ready mix concrete and non-ferrous pipes.
These increases were partially offset by small decreases for a range of other materials.
